summary: View Spanish version of Highlights (PDF, 1 page). In 2014, the President announced a shift in U.S. policy toward Cuba—restoring diplomatic relations, modifying the long-standing economic embargo, and increasing support for the Cuban people, including the nascent private sector. Along with the import of cigars and rum, new U.S. regulations have fostered some travel and commerce with Cuba—but the embargo and Cuban government barriers still...
title: Cuba: U.S. Policy Changes Increased Engagement with Private Sector, but Agency Information Collection Is Limited
